instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans high speed,
threads.message:
Hi there, 

Got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a and it starts normally untill user login screen. After putting password it becomes extremly slow and fans begins to spin high speed. Checked motherboard and there is nothing strange on it. No water damage, nothing. Also Power rails seems to be ok. 

After AHT it says that the computer may have power managment issue. Anyone faced similar things? I suspect it may be trackpad or some flex but actualy dont have new one to check it. 


Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans high speed,
threads.message: Run HWMonitor in the OS and see what sensor is failing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans high speed,
threads.message:
Also try another OSX through USB-C; to discard a software issue.
AHT doesn't give you an error code too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans high speed,
threads.message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 51024"]Run HWMonitor in the OS and see what sensor is failing[/QUOTE]

Seems to be airport Proximity (128 C) and mainboard proximity (128C too). 

AHT says: 

There may be an issue with the System Managment Controller (SMC). Ref: PFM006 
There may be an issue with the power managment system: Ref: PPN001

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans high speed,
threads.message:
Already checked <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>/10/70 and components near and seems to be ok.


P.S: <CHIP>U5800</CHIP> is not present on the board but it is in PDF. Than how it read airport sensor ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans high speed,
threads.message: Airport proximity is fine not on the board. If the mainboard proximity is failing, that could be your issue. Have you tried the board in a known good housing by chance?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans high speed,
threads.message: No, dont have any. so mainboard proximity may be trackpad, keyboard etc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans high speed,
threads.message: solved. Trackpad flex and trackpad changed. Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans high speed,
threads.message: Good job! Kind of suspected that
